item.title: 5 Named discrete random variables
item.description: 5 Named discrete random variables Bernoulli An event has a Bernoulli r.v. if there are only two possible outcomes – “success” ($P(X=1) = p$) and “failure” ($P(X=0) = 1-p$). notation: $X \sim Ber(p)$ range of $X = {0,1}$ $P(X=x) = p^x(1-p)^{1-x}$ $E(X) = p$ $Var(X) = p(1-p)$ Binomial Let X be the number of success in $n$ independent and identical Bernoulli trials with success probability $p$. The distribution of X is Binomial distribution with parameter n and p.
